Package eu.opends.environment

Class TrafficLightPhase

java.lang.Object
eu.opends.environment.TrafficLightPhase
public class TrafficLightPhase
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a traffic light phase. Each phase consists of a unique ID, a number of milliseconds the phase endures (duration) and a string containing a character representation of traffic light states. Every time a phase is used it has to be activated in order to set an expiration time.
Moreover, this class contains a method to read a traffic light's state from the state string ("getState()")
Author:
Rafael Math

  • Constructor Details

    • TrafficLightPhase

      public TrafficLightPhase​(java.lang.String phaseID, int phaseDuration, java.lang.String phaseState)
      Creates a new traffic light phase. Needed parameters are the unique phaseID, the time a phase endures (in seconds) and a state string of length 16 representing the states of the involved traffic lights (e.g. "yyggrrrryyggrrrr").
      Parameters:
      phaseID - Unique phaseID
      phaseDuration - number of steps a phase endures
      phaseState - state string

  • Method Details

    • getID

      public java.lang.String getID()
      Returns the ID of this traffic light phase, which can be set in the external traffic light rules file. Can be used to check if a phase has already been passed, since phases will be arranged in cycles.
      Returns:
      ID of this traffic light phase

    • getDuration

      public long getDuration()
      Returns the duration (in milliseconds) of a traffic light phase.
      Returns:
      Number of milliseconds a phase will endure

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the string representation of a phase.
      E.g. "ID: 01, Duration: 1000, State: yyggrrrryyggrrrr"
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String representation of a phase

    • timeToExpiration

      public long timeToExpiration​(long currentTime)
      Returns the number of milliseconds until the phase expires. This value can be computed by subtracting the current time from the expiration time.
      Parameters:
      currentTime - Current time stamp (number of steps passed so far)
      Returns:
      Number of steps until the phase expires

    • activate

      public void activate​(long currentTime)
      Activates a phase by setting the expiration time. Expiration time is the sum of steps passed so far and the number of steps the phase endures.
      Parameters:
      currentTime - Current time stamp

    • hasExpired

      public boolean hasExpired​(long currentTime)
      Checks whether a phase has expired.
      Parameters:
      currentTime - Current time stamp
      Returns:
      true, if phase has expired

    • getState

      public TrafficLight.TrafficLightState getState​(TrafficLight trafficLight)
      Reads a traffic light's state from this phase's state string.
      Parameters:
      trafficLight - Traffic light to look up in state string
      Returns:
      Traffic light state according to this phase's state string

    • timeSinceActivation

      public long timeSinceActivation​(long currentTime)
      Returns the number of milliseconds since the activation of the phase. This value can be computed by subtracting the time to expiration from the duration time.
      Parameters:
      currentTime - Current time stamp
      Returns:
      Milliseconds since activation
